title: Strengthening CS Practical Competencies: Solving Social Issues Through Narrative-Based Game Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can analyze in-game narrative structures to design systematic strategies for solving complex social issues.

Using mobile collaborative game simulations (e.g., Miro, Gather), learners select one of three real-world social issues (traffic congestion, waste sorting, etc.), apply a three-stage problem-solving process (problem definition → idea generation → action plan) with team members, and present their solution in a 15-minute presentation.
Learners provide feedback on peers' problem-solving projects using game-based assessment rubrics.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
